entry.title: felangel/data_class
entry.summary:
Experimental support for data classes in Dart using macros.

data_class

ğŸš§ Experimental support for data classes in Dart using macros.

âœ¨ Features

ğŸª¨ const constructors with required, named parameters

ğŸ–¨ï¸ copyWith with optional, nullable, named parameters

âœ¨ toString for an improved string representation

â˜¯ï¸ operator== and hashCode for value equality

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Example

import 'package:data_class_macro/data_class_macro.dart';

@Data()
class Person {
  final String name;
}

void main() {
  // ğŸª¨ Create a const instance with required, name parameters.
  const dash = Person(name: 'Dash');

  // ğŸ–¨ï¸ Create copies of your object.
  final sparky = dash.copyWith(name: () => 'Sparky');

  // âœ¨ Human-readable string representation.
  print(dash); // Person(name: Dash)
  print(sparky); // Person(name: Sparky)

  // â˜¯ï¸ Value equality comparisons.
  print(dash == dash.copyWith()); // true
  print(dash == sparky); // false
}

ğŸš€ Quick Start

  1. Switch to the Flutter master channel flutter channel master

  2. Add package:data_class_macro to your pubspec.yaml

    dependencies:
  data_class_macro: ^0.0.0-dev.1

  3. Enable experimental macros in analysis_options.yaml

    analyzer:
  enable-experiment:
    - macros

  4. Use the @Data annotation (see above example).

  5. Run it

    dart --enable-experiment=macros run main.dart

*Requires Dart SDK >= 3.5.0-152.0.dev
